thread.title: Fiction Chronicle: Under the Big, Sad Sky

author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: Under the Big, Sad Sky
text:
Thomas McGuane has lived most of his 78 years in Montana, yet on the evidence of his fiction you get the feeling he still hasn’t totally settled into the place. Interlopers are recurring characters; a sense of estrangement is ubiquitous. Sure, you’ll find horses and hunting and the infrequent Big Sky reverie, but Mr. McGuane has less in common with icons of Western machismo like Jim Harrison and Hemingway than with John Cheever, that meticulous observer of bridge-and-tunnel loneliness. “I have to apologize for replacing cowboys and Indians with generalized anxiety disorder,” he once joked.
His...
